issues.title: Promoter or Re-Distributor
issues.author: SteveLasker
issues.body:
Section [3.4. ](https://ietf-wg-scitt.github.io/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases.html#section-3.4)[Promotion of a Software Component by multiple entities](https://ietf-wg-scitt.github.io/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases.html#name-promotion-of-a-software-com) refers to a **Promoter** as an entity. 

Is this the best way to reference an entity that consumes and re-distributes a package? Are they "promoting" it, which could suggest advertising or some other means to attract users to consume the specific package? Or, are they "re-distributing" a component, and various versions of the component?

comments.author: OR13
comments.body: Seems like distributor would be a better term

issues.title: Air-gap or network isolated network references
issues.author: SteveLasker
issues.body: Section [3.7. ](https://ietf-wg-scitt.github.io/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases.html#section-3.7)[Authentic Software Components in Air-Gapped Infrastructure](https://ietf-wg-scitt.github.io/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases/draft-ietf-scitt-software-use-cases.html#name-authentic-software-componen) uses the term "air-gapped" and "off-line". While "air-gapped" is a common term, it's often used to refer to highly isolated environments. While users are embracing cloud environments, they still wish to maintain network isolation, through virtual private networks. Can/should we reword this section to refer to the more common network isolated environments? The subtle difference between network-isolated and air-gapped is a network-isolated environment may enable ingress/egress rules while an air-gapped environment may implement a data-diode that allows content to go into an environment but the environment can never reach out. (diode = one-way)

comments.author: OR13
comments.body:
It seems worth while to address the isolation levels since each might have different challenges:

- software isolation (like browsers have for private keys per origin)  (same device)
- hardware isolation TPM / TEE (same device)
- hardware gapped networks (network of devices)
- software gapped networks / private clouds ( is there a better word for this ? ) (network of devices)
